Intro: ^The Doctor: Father! Good seeing you today! What do you need?
Hub: ^Where were you during the last full moon?
^What do you think of the rumors?
^What can you tell me about the deaths?
Past: ^The Doctor: Indeed, I am not! I just moved to town about six months ago.

Past_Questions: ^Did you move before or after Phillip's death?

c-0: ^The Doctor: A distant relative of mine left a house here after his untimely death, and I needed a place to perform research. This seemed like a perfect place for that.
^The Doctor: I don't really have anyone waiting for me back home anyway. All the children moved away, so I'm not any more lonely.
c-4: ^The Doctor: Of course! Go right ahead.

Past_Phillip: ^The Doctor: A couple of days before, actually. Of course that didn't look good with the locals, but I was with the innkeeper and his son when it happened.
^The Doctor: Everyone was so frustrated at my allibi, they didn't stop to ask if everyone else had one.

c-1: ^The Doctor: Father, would I admit to such a heinous crime, even if I had committed it?

Past_Outfit: ^The Doctor: It protects me from miasma, and conveniently hides my face.
^Why do you need to protect yourself from miasma?

c-0: ^The Doctor: People are more likely to let you treat them when they don't see the scarring on your face hehe.
c-1: ^The Doctor: You never know where illness may be hiding!
^The Doctor: And with all the corpses piling up, and now our dear gravedigger digging some of them up, we might have it at our doorstep sooner than later.

c-0: ^The Doctor: Check his cabin, I saw him take it there.

c-2: ^The Doctor: From my father. He died of a lung disease and left the uniform to me. Didn't see a use for it until last year, really.

Rumors: ^The Doctor: Sorry Father, you will have to be more specific.

c-0: ^The Doctor: Oh, it's just rumors. These people fear me, so they make things up about me hehe.
c-1: ^The Doctor: That's just my equipment. Nothing you haven't seen where you are from, but it frightens those in town.

Letter: ^The Doctor: Hmm I can't say I do. Why do you ask?
^Not a lot of literate men in town

c-0: ^The Doctor: Ah! You're better asking Mr. Ale, Mr. Smith, or Gregory then.
^The Doctor: I was indeed married but live on my own now. Father Wright and Mr. Barber also knew how to read and write, but I doubt you will be able to get anything out of them now.
^The Doctor: Oh, is that what he says? Uhh... Then forget I said anything!

Opinion: ^The Doctor: Everyone in this town has secrets, Reverend. If you don't know that yet, you will by the end of the night.
^The Doctor: How many people did the demon kill? All of them? Some of them? None of them? I wonder...
^The demon is real. I have seen it.

c-0: ^The Doctor: I never said that. Everyone has the same gut feeling, the same sensation that something is wrong in these woods...
^The Doctor: But is maiming truly unique to the supernatural? Maybe you would only be sending an innocent to the noose by chasing this demon.
^The Doctor: Ha ha ha! I certainly could be!

b: ^ The Doctor: But I wonder if it would even matter now, with so many already plotting behind your back.

c-1: ^The Doctor: Really? Was there anyone around when you saw it? I wonder if there's a connection if that's the case...

Opinion_2: ^The Doctor: That I cannot say! I doubt you will get many clear answers in the short time you have left, so perhaps you should start by looking at those trying to waste it.
^The Doctor: When the clock strikes midnight you will still have to make a decision. Be that what it might be.

Wife: ^The Doctor: My wife...? Oh... She's dead. I'm not as young behind this mask as I might sound hehe.
Wright_Death: ^The Doctor: Since Father Wright locked all the women and children in the chapel, I just spent the night here, cleaning my instruments.
